Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AM-CATH36 (natural AMPs; cathelicidin, the American Alligator, crocodilian, reptiles, animals; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: sequence alignment to identify the conserved cathelin domain followed by AMP mapping.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (89.47%) toAs-CATH4, A. sinensis cathelicidin 4k: 25%; G: 14%; I=L=R: 11%. GRAVY: -0.247; mol Wt: 4076.142; mol formula: C194H337N57O38; mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: active against A. baumannii ATCC 9955 or ATCC BAA-1794 (MIC 1.3 uM), E-faecalis ATCC 22192 or 51299 (MIC > 10 uM), E. coli ATCC 4157 (MIC 34 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 33495 or ATCC BAA-1705 (MIC 1.3-1.4 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 or ATCC BAA-2110 (MIC 1.3 uM), and S. aureus ATCC 25923 or 33592 (MIC 5.1 uM).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 50% TFE or SDS.Toxicity: sheep RBC: <0.5% hemolysis at 300 ug/ml, not hemo.lytic. Also not toxic to human lung epithelial cells A549 at 100 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Barksdale SM, Hrifko EJ, van Hoek ML. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Cathelicidin antimicrobial peptide from Alligator mississippiensis has antibacterial activity against multi-drug resistant Acinetobacter baumanii and Klebsiella pneumoniae.
